cohort.bio:
During my time as a teacher I was surrounded by people who were eager to learn. I was inspired to pursue learning software development when our school district had a coding initiative that taught students and teachers the basics of coding. Once I finished the few rudimentary exercises they had for us, I was hooked. I ate up everything related to software and web development. So much so that I decided to make a career change to become a software developer.

I chose to go to Nashville Software School because of their strong track record of success and the 6 month time table was ideal for my situation. During my time at NSS I have had the opportunity to develop software in several languages such as: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS, C#, .NET, and SQL. I am on track to graduate from NSS on March 23, 2018. I am looking for a junior software development job in the Nashville area. I have a passion for software development and a love of learning. I am a driven individual who doesn’t give up until the job is done.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Practice does not make perfect. Only perfect practice makes perfect." - Vince Lombardi
cohort.bio:
Growing up as a musician, I always wanted to advance my skills and expand my vocabulary on my instrument. It is this same approach that I bring to software development. The more you practice and learn, the easier it is to express yourself creatively. As an artistic person, it bothers me when I can see the end vision of a project, but do not have the necessary skills to implement said project. I am determined to remove as many of these barriers as possible.

I started my developer career path on my own, and for almost a year, I absorbed everything I could.I was able to attain a firm grasp on programming fundamentals and was quickly solving more complex problems.Before the year was over, I made the decision to attend Nashville Software School 's full-stack web development course. My goal was to learn industry best-practices and become career ready.

cohort.reelThemIn: Software Developer | Sound Designer | Sandwich Devotee
cohort.bio:
I am a sound designer jumping head-first into the world of coding! After years of pursuing and studying audio production, I have switched my focus to software development, because of the opportunity for constantly learning and problem solving. Nashville Software School has shaped me to think like a software developer. Beyond that, the program has taught me how to work in a group environment and the importance of writing code that not only executes correctly, but is readable to others.

I also have an uncanny ability to find the perfect place for lunch!

Hello, its me, the ever-elusive Nashville native. For a long time, I only knew two things, I loved my city and I wanted to make it a better place. It wasn't until I started coding that I felt like I had the tools to make an impact. For me, software development combines everything I love about learning and problem solving. It fuels my imagination and brings order to chaos. It always pushes me learn more and seek a deeper understanding. We have a saying in my house, "I can do all things through Google who strengthens me". There's nothing like the power of the internet combined with a can-do attitude. I would know. It has taken me far.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Nothing you have not given away will ever really be yours." ― C.S. Lewis
cohort.bio: Growing up in Detroit, I always put my entire self into whatever I was doing. Whether I was playing sports or music, I wanted to spend all my time and energy into that focus. Through a long journey of different jobs and career directions, I finally landed in software development. I am task-oriented and a problem solver so web development has been a great fit. Now having landed in the Nashville Software School, I know I have found a career pursuit with a future and that fits my strengths.
I love to learn new things, critical thinking and creativity brings out my passion to solve and learn simultaneously.

cohort.reelThemIn: Gradually falling more and more in love with Python.
cohort.bio: I am a life-long learner and curious about everything. This curiosity has led me many places, including software development. Before attending NSS, I primarily worked in administrative roles where I utilized my ability to problem solve and work on teams. I love working with people and thrive with structure. I am excited to apply my skills and knowledge and look forward to seeing where a career in software development will take me.

cohort.reelThemIn: “There is no end to education. It is not that you read a book, pass an examination, and finish with education. The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.” – Jiddu Krishnamurti
cohort.bio: I choose to become a software developer after graduating from college wanting to continue with work that was both mentally stimulating and personally satisfying. For me, there’s nothing more satisfying than to think creatively about how to solve a problem and then to carry out the with the solution.

cohort.reelThemIn: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Python, Django
cohort.bio: Raised in Franklin, Tennessee. I love art, math, science, and coding, of course. I enjoy learning new and creative ways to solve interesting problems in order to create something fun and interesting. Coding is a great fit for me because of this, and since I consider myself to be a lifelong learner, I don't expect myself to stop enjoying coding anytime soon.

Before my journey into software development, I worked as a full time music teacher, teaching all ages, guitar, voice, bass, ukulele, songwriting and rock bands. I had been entertaining the idea of entering the world of tech for years, since I enjoy being in front of the computer, troubleshooting, and creating solutions to problems.
